org.apache.juneau.rest

Class RequestBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.juneau.rest.RequestBody

  • public class RequestBody
extends Object
    Contains the body of the HTTP request.
    See Also:
    • Overview > juneau-rest-server > @RestMethod > RequestBody

    • Method Detail

      • asType

        public <T> T asType(Class<T> type)
             throws BadRequest,
                    UnsupportedMediaType,
                    InternalServerError
        Reads the input from the HTTP request parsed into a POJO.

        The parser used is determined by the matching Content-Type header on the request.

        If type is null or Object.class, then the actual type will be determined automatically based on the following input:

        TypeJSON inputXML inputReturn type
        object "{...}" <object>...</object>
        <x type='object'>...</x>        		 ObjectMap
        array "[...]" <array>...</array>
        <x type='array'>...</x>        		 ObjectList
        string "'...'" <string>...</string>
        <x type='string'>...</x>        		 String
        number 123 <number>123</number>
        <x type='number'>...</x>        		 Number
        boolean true <boolean>true</boolean>
        <x type='boolean'>...</x>        		 Boolean
        null null or blank <null/> or blank
        <x type='null'/>        		 null

        Refer to POJO Categories for a complete definition of supported POJOs.

        Examples:

        // Parse into an integer. int body = req.getBody().asType(int.class); // Parse into an int array. int[] body = req.getBody().asType(int[].class); // Parse into a bean. MyBean body = req.getBody().asType(MyBean.class); // Parse into a linked-list of objects. List body = req.getBody().asType(LinkedList.class); // Parse into a map of object keys/values. Map body = req.getBody().asType(TreeMap.class);

        Notes:
        • If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to instantiate.
        Parameters:
        type - The class type to instantiate.
        Returns:
        The input parsed to a POJO.
        Throws:
        BadRequest - Thrown if input could not be parsed or fails schema validation.
        UnsupportedMediaType - Thrown if the Content-Type header value is not supported by one of the parsers.
        InternalServerError - Thrown if an IOException occurs.

      • asType

        public <T> T asType(Type type,
                    Type... args)
             throws BadRequest,
                    UnsupportedMediaType,
                    InternalServerError
        Reads the input from the HTTP request parsed into a POJO.

        This is similar to asType(Class) but allows for complex collections of POJOs to be created.

        Examples:

        // Parse into a linked-list of strings. List<String> body = req.getBody().asType(LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a linked-list of linked-lists of strings. List<List<String>> body = req.getBody().asType(LinkedList.class, LinkedList.class, String.class); // Parse into a map of string keys/values. Map<String,String> body = req.getBody().asType(TreeMap.class, String.class, String.class); // Parse into a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans. Map<String,List<MyBean>> body = req.getBody().asType(TreeMap.class, String.class, List.class, MyBean.class);

        Notes:
        • Collections must be followed by zero or one parameter representing the value type.
        • Maps must be followed by zero or two parameters representing the key and value types.
        • If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The class type to instantiate.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of object to create.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        args - The type arguments of the class if it's a collection or map.
        Can be any of the following: ClassMeta, Class, ParameterizedType, GenericArrayType
        Ignored if the main type is not a map or collection.
        Returns:
        The input parsed to a POJO.
        Throws:
        BadRequest - Thrown if input could not be parsed or fails schema validation.
        UnsupportedMediaType - Thrown if the Content-Type header value is not supported by one of the parsers.
        InternalServerError - Thrown if an IOException occurs.

      • asString

        public String asString()
                throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a plain string.
        Notes:
        • If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.
        Returns:
        The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.

      • asHex

        public String asHex()
             throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a simple hexadecimal character string.
        Example:

        0123456789ABCDEF

        Returns:
        The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.

      • asSpacedHex

        public String asSpacedHex()
                   throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a simple space-delimited hexadecimal character string.
        Example:

        01 23 45 67 89 AB CD EF

        Returns:
        The incoming input from the connection as a plain string.
        Throws:
        IOException - If a problem occurred trying to read from the reader.

      • getReader

        public BufferedReader getReader()
                         throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as a Reader.
        Notes:
        • If allowHeaderParams init parameter is true, then first looks for &body=xxx in the URL query string.
        • Automatically handles GZipped input streams.
        Returns:
        The body contents as a reader.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getUnbufferedReader

        protected Reader getUnbufferedReader()
                              throws IOException
        Same as getReader(), but doesn't encapsulate the result in a BufferedReader;
        Returns:
        An unbuffered reader.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • getInputStream

        public javax.servlet.ServletInputStream getInputStream()
                                                throws IOException
        Returns the HTTP body content as an InputStream.
        Returns:
        The negotiated input stream.
        Throws:
        IOException - If any error occurred while trying to get the input stream or wrap it in the GZIP wrapper.

      • getParserMatch

        public ParserMatch getParserMatch()
        Returns the parser and media type matching the request Content-Type header.
        Returns:
        The parser matching the request Content-Type header, or null if no matching parser was found. Includes the matching media type.

      • getParser

        public Parser getParser()
        Returns the parser matching the request Content-Type header.
        Returns:
        The parser matching the request Content-Type header, or null if no matching parser was found.

      • getReaderParser

        public ReaderParser getReaderParser()
        Returns the reader parser matching the request Content-Type header.
        Returns:
        The reader parser matching the request Content-Type header, or null if no matching reader parser was found, or the matching parser was an input stream parser.

      • getInputStreamParser

        public InputStreamParser getInputStreamParser()
        Returns the input stream parser matching the request Content-Type header.
        Returns:
        The input stream parser matching the request Content-Type header, or null if no matching reader parser was found, or the matching parser was a reader parser.

      • getContentLength

        public int getContentLength()
        Returns the content length of the body.
        Returns:
        The content length of the body in bytes.
